content:
DebuggerManager.IslandThread Class

Definition

Executes the islands on a dedicated worker thread. The worker thread's physical callstack then maps to the interpreter's virtual callstack.

In this Article

public sealed class DebuggerManager.IslandThread : IDisposable
Inheritance
Object
DebuggerManager.IslandThread

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object, Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object, Object)
ToString()

Methods

IslandWorker(DebuggerManager+IslandThread)

Private entry point called from islands. Must be public so that the islands can invoke it. Called on debugger worker thread.

public static void IslandWorker (Microsoft.Build.Debugging.DebuggerManager.IslandThread controller);
Parameters
controller

The thread calling the entry point.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IDisposable.Dispose()

Releases all resources used by the current instance of the DebuggerManager.IslandThread class.

void IDisposable.Dispose ();

Remarks

Call Dispose when you are finished using the DebuggerManager.IslandThread. After calling Dispose, you must release all references to the DebuggerManager.IslandThread so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that it was using.

For more information, see Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources and Implementing a Dispose Method.

Note

Always call Dispose before you release your last reference to the DebuggerManager.IslandThread. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the DebuggerManager.IslandThread object's Finalize method.
